member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.CodedUITestAttribute
member.summary: Used to activate the extension so that we recognize a class as Unit Test extension class. Use [CodedUITest] attribute in test class to indicate that it is a Coded UI Test
Used to activate the extension so that we recognize a class as Unit Test extension class. Use [CodedUITest] attribute in test class to indicate that it is a Coded UI Test

member.summary: This is eventhandler for thte TestStopping event that is raised when the CUIT is either aborting or times out. If the playback is going on it is cancelled so that abort and cleanup can happen gracefully.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Failed to load Coded UI Test Package..

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Resources.Iteration
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to iteration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Resources.Process64BitError
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The Coded UITest cannot be run as a 64 bit process. You must change your test settings in the Hosts tab to run your test in a 32 bit process. For more information on creating test settings, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=246440&clcid=0x409..

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Resources.ScreenShotFailure
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Failed to take screen shot: {0}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Resources.ScreenShotMessage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Failure Screen Shot: {0}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.Resources.WinBlueRequired
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to You cannot run Coded UI tests for Windows Store apps on this platform. For details on platform support, please refer to {0}..

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.TestTools.UITesting.AutoWaitCursor
